column4: my system doesn't boot anymore, and I can't mount my two linux partition from the live cd (only the windows partition is mountable), can someone help me ?
did you run fsck on them?
it doesn't work for "sudo fsck /dev/hda3" (my main linux partition), it says "fsck.ext3: Filesystem revision too high...
the superblock looks to be corrupted
do you think i should better try from knoppix ?
If fsck can't run on it, I don't know any other 'fix' than to reformat the partitions
but i have very important datas on my partition...
but if they're hosed, you can't save the data
anyway maybe someone else has a suggestion, though I doubt anything will work when fsck doesn't even run on the partitions
what does fdisk -y do? and why ary you running fdisk on a partition instead of a disk?
my eyes are tired. I misread what you typed, sorry
